FR: A l'orée d'une grande forêt vivaient un pauvre bûcheron,
GLOSS_LSF: FORET BORD VIVRE BUCHERON PAUVRE
GENERATED_LSF: OREE GRANDE FORET VIVAIENT PAUVRE BUCHERON
EN: Near a great forest there lived a poor woodcutter
GENERATED_EN: At the edge of a large forest lived a poor woodcutter,

FR: sa femme
GLOSS_LSF: SA FEMME
EN: and his wife,
GENERATED_EN: his wife

FR: et ses deux enfants.
GLOSS_LSF: SES DEUX ENFANTS
EN: and his two children;
GENERATED_EN: and his two children.

FR: Le garçon s'appelait Hansel et la fille Grethel.
GLOSS_LSF: GARCON S'APPELER HANSEL FILLE S'APPELER GRETHEL
EN: the boy's name was Hansel and the girl's Grethel.
GENERATED_EN: The boy's name was Hansel and the girl was Grethel.

FR: La famille ne mangeait guère.
GLOSS_LSF: FAMILLE PAS MANGER
EN: They had very little to bite or to sup,
GENERATED_EN: The family did not eat much.

FR: Une année que la famine régnait dans le pays
GLOSS_LSF: UN AN FAMINE PARTOUT PAYS
EN: and once, when there was great dearth in the land,
GENERATED_EN: A year that famine reigned in the country

FR: et que le pain lui-même vint à manquer,
GLOSS_LSF: MEME PAIN MANQUER
EN: the man could not even gain the daily bread.
GENERATED_EN: and the bread itself ran out,

FR: une nuit, dans son lit ruminant ses idées noires,
GLOSS_LSF: UNE NUIT BUCHERON DANS LIT IDEE NOIR RUMINER
EN: As he lay in bed one night thinking of this,
GENERATED_EN: one night, in his bed ruminating his dark thoughts,

FR: et remâchait ses soucis.
GLOSS_LSF: SOUCIS SOUCIS
EN: and turning and tossing,
GENERATED_EN: and chewed on his worries.

FR: et dit à sa femme
GLOSS_LSF: BUCHERON DIRE SA FEMME
EN: and said to his wife,
GENERATED_EN: and said to his wife

FR: Qu'allons-nous devenir?
GLOSS_LSF: NOUS DEVENIR QUOI ?
EN: What will become of us?
GENERATED_EN: What will become of us?

FR: Comment nourrir nos pauvres enfants,
GLOSS_LSF: COMMENT NOURRIR NOS PAUVRE ENFANTS ?
EN: we cannot even feed our children;
GENERATED_EN: How to feed our poor children,

FR: quand nous n'avons plus rien pour nous-mêmes?
GLOSS_LSF: NOUS MEME PAS SE NOURRIR ?
EN: there is nothing left for ourselves.
GENERATED_EN: when we have nothing left for ourselves?

FR: Eh bien, mon homme,
GLOSS_LSF: SA FEMME REPONDRE
EN: I will tell you what, husband,
GENERATED_EN: Well, my man,

FR: dit la femme,
GLOSS_LSF: EH BIEN CHERI
EN: answered the wife;
GENERATED_EN: said the woman,

FR: Dès l'aube, nous conduirons les enfants au plus profond de la forêt
GLOSS_LSF: AUBE NOUS AMENER ENFANT FORET AU FOND
GENERATED_LSF: AUBE ENFANTS PLUS PROFOND FORET CONDUIRE
EN: we will take the children early in the morning into the forest, where it is thickest;
GENERATED_EN: At dawn, we will lead the children deep into the forest

FR: nous leur allumerons un feu
GLOSS_LSF: ALLUMER FEU
EN: we will make them a fire,
GENERATED_EN: we will light a fire for them

FR: et leur donnerons à chacun un petit morceau de pain.
GLOSS_LSF: DONNER CHACUN MORCEAU PAIN
EN: and we will give each of them a piece of bread,
GENERATED_EN: and give them each a small piece of bread.

FR: Puis nous irons à notre travail et les laisserons seuls.
GLOSS_LSF: NOUS RETOURNER TRAVAIL LAISSER EUX SEUL
EN: then we will go to our work and leave them alone;
GENERATED_EN: Then we will go to our work and leave them alone.

FR: Ils ne retrouveront plus leur chemin
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX ENFANTS PAS RETROUVER LEUR CHEMIN
EN: they will never find the way home again,
GENERATED_EN: They will not find their way back

FR: et nous en serons débarrassés.
GLOSS_LSF: DEBARASSER EUX NOUS SEUL
EN: and we shall be quit of them.
GENERATED_EN: and we will be rid of them.

FR: Non, femme, dit le bûcheron. je ne ferai pas cela!
GLOSS_LSF: BUCHERON REPONDRE NON FEMME MOI REFUSER
GENERATED_LSF: NON FEMME BUCHERON DIRE NE FERAI PAS
EN: No, wife, said the man, I cannot do that;
GENERATED_EN: No, woman," said the woodcutter, "I won't do that!

FR: Comment pourrais-je me résoudre à laisser nos enfants tout seuls dans la forêt!
GLOSS_LSF: COMMENT MOI ACCEPTER LAISSER NOS ENFANTS SEULS DANS FORET
GENERATED_LSF: COMMENT POURRAIS ENFANTS TOUT SEULS FORET RESOUDRE LAISSER
EN: I cannot find in my heart to take my children into the forest and to leave them there alone;
GENERATED_EN: How could I bring myself to leave our children alone in the forest!

FR: Les bêtes sauvages ne tarderaient pas à les dévorer.
GLOSS_LSF: ANIMAUX SAUVAGES MANGER EUX
GENERATED_LSF: BETES SAUVAGES NE PAS TARDER DEVORER
EN: the wild animals would soon come and devour them.
GENERATED_EN: The wild beasts would soon devour them.

FR: Oh! fou, rétorqua-t-elle, tu préfères donc que nous mourions de faim tous les quatre?
GLOSS_LSF: FEMME REPONDRE OH FOU ! TOI PREFERER NOUS QUATRE MOURIR FAIM ?
GENERATED_LSF: FOU RETORQUA TOI PREFERES DONC FAIM TOUS QUATRE MOURIR
EN: O you fool, said she, then we will all four starve;
GENERATED_EN: Oh, madman," she retorted, "would you rather the four of us starved to death?

FR: Alors, il ne te reste qu'à raboter les planches de nos cercueils.
GLOSS_LSF: OUI ? ALORS PREPARE NOS CERCUEILS
GENERATED_LSF: ALORS NE PLANCHES CERCUEILS RESTE RABOTER
EN: you had better get the coffins ready,
GENERATED_EN: So, all you have to do is plane the boards of our coffins.

FR: Elle n'eut de cesse qu'il n'acceptât ce qu'elle proposait.
GLOSS_LSF: BUCHERON PAS D'AUTRE CHOIX ACCEPTER
EN: and she left him no peace until he consented.
GENERATED_EN: She did not stop until he accepted what she proposed.

FR: Mais j'ai quand même pitié de ces pauvres enfants, dit le bûcheron.
GLOSS_LSF: BUCHERON DIRE MEME PITIER DEUX PAUVRE ENFANTS
GENERATED_LSF: QUAND MEME PITIE PAUVRES ENFANTS AVOIR BUCHERON DIRE
EN: But I really pity the poor children, said the man.
GENERATED_EN: But I still feel sorry for these poor children," said the woodcutter.

FR: Les deux petits n'avaient pas pu s'endormir tant ils avaient faim.
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX ENFANTS TRES FAIM PAS DORMIR
GENERATED_LSF: DEUX PETITS PAS TANT FAIM PU ENDORMIR AVOIR
EN: The two children had not been able to sleep for hunger,
GENERATED_EN: The two little ones could not fall asleep because they were so hungry.

FR: Ils avaient entendu ce que la marâtre disait à leur père.
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX ENTENDRE TOUT LEUR MERE DIRE LEUR PERE
EN: and had heard what their step-mother had said to their father.
GENERATED_EN: They had heard what the stepmother said to their father.

FR: Grethel pleura des larmes amères et dit à son frère:
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL PLEURER PLEURER ELLE DIRE SON FRERE
GENERATED_LSF: GRETHEL LARMES AMERES FRERE PLEURER DIRE
EN: Grethel wept bitterly,
GENERATED_EN: Grethel wept bitter tears and said to her brother

FR: C'en est fait de nous
GLOSS_LSF: NOUS PIEGER
EN: and said to Hansel, It is all over with us.
GENERATED_EN: It's over for us

FR: Du calme, Grethel, dit Hansel.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL REPONDRE CALME TOI
EN: Do be quiet, Grethel, said Hansel,
GENERATED_EN: Calm down, Grethel," said Hansel.

FR: Ne t'en fais pas;
GLOSS_LSF: T'INQUIETE PAS
EN: and do not fret;
GENERATED_EN: Don't worry about it;

FR: Je trouverai un moyen de nous en tirer.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI TROUVER METHODE S'ECHAPPER
EN: I will manage something.
GENERATED_EN: I'll find a way out of this.

FR: Quand les parents furent endormis, il se leva,
GLOSS_LSF: PARENTS S'ENDORMIR GARCON LEVER
EN: And when the parents had gone to sleep he got up,
GENERATED_EN: When the parents were asleep, he got up,

FR: enfila ses habits,
GLOSS_LSF: HABITS ENFILER
EN: put on his little coat,
GENERATED_EN: put on his clothes,

FR: ouvrit la porte arrière et se glissa dehors.
GLOSS_LSF: PORTE ARRIERE OUVRIR FAUFILER DEHORS
EN: opened the back door, and slipped out.
GENERATED_EN: opened the back door and slipped out. and slipped out.

FR: La lune brillait dans le ciel
GLOSS_LSF: LUNE CIEL BRILLER
EN: The moon was shining brightly,
GENERATED_EN: The moon was shining in the sky

FR: et les graviers blancs, devant la maison, étincelaient comme des diamants.
GLOSS_LSF: MAISON DEVANT GRAVIERS BLANC ETINCELER COMME DIAMANTS
EN: and the white flints that lay in front of the house glistened like pieces of silver.
GENERATED_EN: and the white gravel in front of the house sparkled like diamonds.

FR: Hansel se pencha et en mit dans ses poches autant qu'il put.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL PENCHER RAMASSER METTRE POCHE JUSQU’A POCHE PLEINE
GENERATED_LSF: HANSEL POCHES AUTANT PUT PENCHER METTRE
EN: Hansel stooped and filled the little pocket of his coat as full as it would hold.
GENERATED_EN: Hansel bent down and stuffed as much as he could into his pockets.

FR: Puis il rentra dans la maison et dit à Grethel:
GLOSS_LSF: MAISON RENTRER DIRE GRETHEL
EN: Then he went back again,
GENERATED_EN: Then he went back into the house and said to Grethel:

FR: Aie confiance, chère petite soeur,
GLOSS_LSF: CONFIANCE MOI PETITE SŒUR
EN: and said to Grethel, Be easy, dear little sister,
GENERATED_EN: Have confidence, dear little sister,

FR: et dors tranquille.
GLOSS_LSF: DORS TRANQUILLE
EN: and go to sleep quietly;
GENERATED_EN: and sleep well.

FR: Dieu ne nous abandonnera pas.
GLOSS_LSF: DIEU PAS ABANDONNER NOUS
EN: God will not forsake us,
GENERATED_EN: God will not abandon us.

FR: Et lui-même se recoucha.
GLOSS_LSF: LUI-MÊME RECOUCHER
EN: and laid himself down again in his bed.
GENERATED_EN: And he himself went back to bed.

FR: Quand vint le jour,
GLOSS_LSF: JOUR LEVER
EN: When the day was breaking,
GENERATED_EN: When the day came,

FR: avant même que le soleil ne se levât,
GLOSS_LSF: AVANT SOLEIL LEVER
EN: and before the sun had risen,
GENERATED_EN: even before the sun came up,

FR: la femme réveilla les deux enfants:
GLOSS_LSF: FEMME REVEILLER DEUX ENFANTS
EN: the wife came and awakened the two children,
GENERATED_EN: the woman woke the two children:

FR: Debout, paresseux!
GLOSS_LSF: FEMME DIRE DEBOUT PARESSEUX !
EN: saying, Get up, you lazy bones;
GENERATED_EN: Get up, lazybones!

FR: Nous allons aller dans la forêt pour y chercher du bois.
GLOSS_LSF: NOUS QUATRE ALLER DANS FORET CHERCHER BOIS
EN: we are going into the forest to cut wood.
GENERATED_EN: We will go to the forest to look for wood.

FR: Elle leur donna un morceau de pain à chacun
GLOSS_LSF: MERE DONNER MORCEAU PAIN CHACUN
EN: Then she gave each of them a piece of bread,
GENERATED_EN: She gave them each a piece of bread

FR: et dit: Voici pour le repas de midi;
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE DIRE VOILA POUR REPAS MIDI
EN: and said, That is for dinner,
GENERATED_EN: and said: Here is for the noon meal;

FR: ne mangez pas tout avant,
GLOSS_LSF: MANGER PAS TOUT AVANT
EN: and you must not eat it before then,
GENERATED_EN: don't eat everything first,

FR: car vous n'aurez rien d'autre.
GLOSS_LSF: CAR PAS D'AUTRE
EN: for you will get no more.
GENERATED_EN: because you won't get anything else.

FR: Grethel mit le pain dans son tablier,
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL METTRE PAIN DANS SON TABLIER
EN: Grethel carried the bread under her apron,
GENERATED_EN: Grethel put the bread in her apron,

FR: comme les poches de Hansel étaient pleines de cailloux,
GLOSS_LSF: PAR POCHE HANSEL REMPLI CAILLOUX
EN: for Hansel had his pockets full of the flints.
GENERATED_EN: as Hansel's pockets were full of pebbles,

FR: Puis, ils se mirent tous en route pour la forêt.
GLOSS_LSF: TOUS QUATRE MARCHER FORET
EN: Then they set off all together on their way to the forest.
GENERATED_EN: Then they all set out for the forest.

FR: Au bout de quelque temps, Hansel s'arrêta et regarda en direction de la maison.
GLOSS_LSF: QUELQUE TEMPS APRES HANSEL S'ARRETER RETOURNER REGARDER MAISON
GENERATED_LSF: BOUT TEMPS HANSEL ARRETA DIRECTION MAISON REGARDA
EN: When they had gone a little way Hansel stood still and looked back towards the house,
GENERATED_EN: After a while, Hansel stopped and looked in the direction of the house.

FR: Et sans cesse, il répétait ce geste.
GLOSS_LSF: REPETER MEME CHOSE CHAQUE FOIS
EN: and this he did again and again, till his father said to him,
GENERATED_EN: And over and over again, he repeated this gesture.

FR: Le père dit: Que regardes-tu, Hansel, et pourquoi restes-tu toujours en arrière?
GLOSS_LSF: PERE DIRE REGARDE QUOI POUR TOI GROUPE DERRIERE ?
GENERATED_LSF: PERE DIT TOI REGARDES HANSEL POURQUOI RESTES TOI TOUJOURS ARRIERE
EN: Hansel, what are you looking at?
GENERATED_EN: The father said: What are you looking at, Hansel, and why do you always stay behind?

FR: Fais attention à toi et n'oublie pas de marcher!
GLOSS_LSF: FAIS ATTENTION CONTINUE MARCHER !
GENERATED_LSF: FAIS ATTENTION TOI PAS MARCHER OUBLIE
EN: take care not to forget your legs.
GENERATED_EN: Take care of yourself and don't forget to walk!

FR: Ah! père dit Hansel, Je regarde mon petit chat blanc qui est perché là-haut sur le toit et je lui dis au revoir.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL REPONDRE AH PERE MOI REGARDER MON PETIT CHAT BLANC MAISON TOIT PERCHER
GENERATED_LSF: AH PERE HANSEL DIT PETIT CHAT BLANC LA HAUT TOIT REVOIR REGARDE PERCHE
EN: O father, said Hansel, I am looking at my little white kitten, who is sitting up on the roof to bid me good-bye.
GENERATED_EN: Ah! Father says Hansel, I look at my little white cat who is perched up there on the roof and I say goodbye to him.

FR: La femme dit: Fou que tu es!
GLOSS_LSF: FEMME REPONDRE TOI FOU !
EN: You young fool, said the woman,
GENERATED_EN: The woman said: "You are crazy!

FR: ce n'est pas le chaton, c'est un reflet de soleil sur la cheminée.
GLOSS_LSF: CA PAS CHATON CHEMINE REFLET SOLEIL
EN: that is not your kitten, but the sunshine on the chimney-pot.
GENERATED_EN: it's not the kitten, it's a reflection of the sun on the fireplace.

FR: Hansel, en réalité, n'avait pas vu le chat.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL VRAI PAS VU CHAT
EN: Of course Hansel had not been looking at his kitten,
GENERATED_EN: Hansel, in fact, had not seen the cat.

FR: Mais, à chaque arrêt, il prenait un caillou blanc dans sa poche et le jetait sur le chemin.
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS CHAQUE FOIS S'ARRETER CAILLOUX BLANC POCHE PRENDRE CHEMIN JETER
GENERATED_LSF: ARRET CAILLOU BLANC POCHE JETAIT CHEMIN PRENDRE
EN: but had been taking every now and then a flint from his pocket and dropping it on the road.
GENERATED_EN: But, at each stop, he would take a white pebble from his pocket and throw it on the path.

FR: Quand ils furent arrivés au milieu de la forêt, le père dit: Maintenant, les enfants, ramassez du bois! je vais allumer un feu pour que vous n'ayez pas froid.
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND ARRIVER FORET MILIEUX PERE DIRE MAINTENANT RAMASSER BOIS ! MOI ALLUMER FEU POUR PAS FROID
GENERATED_LSF: MILIEU FORET ARRIVES PERE DIT MAINTENANT ENFANTS RAMASSEZ BOIS FEU PAS FROID ALLER ALLUMER AVOIR
EN: When they reached the middle of the forest the father told the children to collect wood to make a fire to keep them, warm;
GENERATED_EN: When they arrived in the middle of the forest, the father said, "Now, children, gather wood! I will light a fire so that you will not be cold.

FR: Hansel et Grethel amassèrent des brindilles au sommet d'une petite colline.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL GRETHEL COLINE SOMMET RAMASSER BRINDILLES
GENERATED_LSF: HANSEL GRETHEL BRINDILLES SOMMET PETITE COLLINE AMASSER
EN: and Hansel and Grethel gathered brushwood enough for a little mountain
GENERATED_EN: Hansel and Grethel gathered twigs on top of a small hill.

FR: Quand on y eut mit le feu et qu'il eut bien pris,
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND REUSSIR ALLUMER FEU FEU FEU
EN: and it was set on fire, and when the flame was burning quite high the wife said,
GENERATED_EN: When the fire had been set and it had taken well,

FR: la femme dit: Couchez-vous auprès de lui, les enfants, et reposez-vous.
GLOSS_LSF: FEMME DIRE ALLONGER VOUS A COTE FEU REPOSER VOUS
GENERATED_LSF: FEMME DIRE COUCHEZ AUPRES ENFANTS REPOSER
EN: Now lie down by the fire and rest yourselves, you children,
GENERATED_EN: the woman said, "Lie down with him, children, and rest.

FR: Nous allons abattre du bois.
GLOSS_LSF: NOUS ABATTRE BOIS
EN: and we will go and cut wood;
GENERATED_EN: We are going to chop wood.

FR: Quand nous aurons fini, nous reviendrons vous chercher.
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND NOUS DEUX FINI NOUS REVENIR VOUS CHERCHER
EN: and when we are ready we will come and fetch you.
GENERATED_EN: When we're done, we'll come back for you.

FR: Hansel et Grethel s'assirent auprès du feu
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL GRETHEL S'ASSOIR PRES FEU
EN: So Hansel and Grethel sat by the fire,
GENERATED_EN: Hansel and Grethel sat by the fire

FR: et quand vint l'heure du déjeuner, ils mangèrent leur morceau de pain.
GLOSS_LSF: L'HEURE MANGER DEUX MANGER MORCEAU PAIN
GENERATED_LSF: HEURE VENIR DEJEUNER MORCEAU PAIN MANGER
EN: and at noon they each ate their pieces of bread.
GENERATED_EN: and when it was time for lunch, they ate their piece of bread.

FR: Ils entendaient retentir des coups de hache et pensaient que leur père était tout proche.
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX ENTENDRE BRUIT COUP HACHE PENSER LEUR PERE PROCHE
GENERATED_LSF: COUPS HACHE PERE TOUT PROCHE ENTENDRE RETENTIR PENSER
EN: They thought their father was in the wood all the time, as they seemed to hear the strokes of the axe:
GENERATED_EN: They heard the sound of axes and thought their father was close by.

FR: Mais ce n'était pas la hache. C'était une branche que le bûcheron avait attachée à un arbre mort et que le vent faisait battre de-ci, de-là.
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS HACHE NON BUCHERON PREPARER AVANT BRANCHE ATTACHER ARBRE MORT VENT BOUGER BRANCHE COGNER ARBRE MORT
GENERATED_LSF: PAS HACHE BRANCHE BUCHERON ARBRE MORT VENT BATTRE DE-CI ATTACHEE FAIRE DE-LA
EN: but really it was only a dry branch hanging to a withered tree that the wind moved to and fro.
GENERATED_EN: But it wasn't the axe. It was a branch that the woodcutter had tied to a dead tree and that the wind was blowing here and there.

FR: Comme ils étaient assis là depuis des heures, les yeux finirent par leur tomber de fatigue
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX ASSOIR LONGTEMPS FATIGUER
GENERATED_LSF: LA HEURES ASSIS YEUX FATIGUE FINIR TOMBER
EN: So when they had stayed there a long time their eyelids closed with weariness,
GENERATED_EN: As they had been sitting there for hours, their eyes finally fell out from fatigue

FR: et ils s'endormirent.
GLOSS_LSF: S'ENDORMIR
EN: and they fell fast asleep.
GENERATED_EN: and they fell asleep.

FR: Quand ils se réveillèrent, il faisait nuit noire.
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX REVEILLER NUIT NOIR
EN: When at last they woke it was night,
GENERATED_EN: When they woke up, it was dark.

FR: Grethel se mit à pleurer et dit:
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL PLEURER DIRE
EN: and Grethel began to cry,
GENERATED_EN: Grethel began to cry and said:

FR: Comment ferons-nous pour sortir de la forêt?
GLOSS_LSF: COMMENT NOUS SORTIR FORET ?
EN: and said, How shall we ever get out of this wood?
GENERATED_EN: How will we get out of the forest?

FR: Hansel la consola. Attends encore un peu, dit-il, jusqu'à ce que la lune soit levée.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL CONSOLER ELLE DIRE ATTEND ENCORE UN PEU JUSQU’À LUNE LEVER
GENERATED_LSF: HANSEL CONSOLA ATTENDS ENCORE PEU DIT LUNE LEVEE
EN: But Hansel comforted her, saying, Wait a little while longer, until the moon rises,
GENERATED_EN: Hansel consoled her. Wait a little longer," he said, "until the moon is up.

FR: Alors, nous retrouverons notre chemin.
GLOSS_LSF: CE MOMENT LA NOUS RETROUVER NOTRE CHEMIN
EN: and then we can easily find the way home.
GENERATED_EN: Then we will find our way back.

FR: Quand la pleine lune brilla dans le ciel, il prit sa soeur par la main
GLOSS_LSF: LUNE PLEINE CIEL BRILLER GARCON PRENDRE MAIN FILLE
GENERATED_LSF: PLEINE LUNE CIEL BRILLA SOEUR MAIN PRENDRE
EN: And when the full moon got up Hansel took his little sister by the hand,
GENERATED_EN: When the full moon shone in the sky, he took his sister by the hand

FR: et suivit les petits cailloux blancs. Ils étincelaient comme des écus frais battus et indiquaient le chemin.
GLOSS_LSF: SUIVRE PETIT CAILLOUX BLANC EUX BRILLER COMME PIECE TOUTE PRETE DONNER EUX CHEMIN
GENERATED_LSF: PETITS CAILLOUX BLANCS SUIVRE ETINCELAIENT ECUS FRAIS BATTUS CHEMIN INDIQUER
EN: and followed the way where the flint stones shone like silver, and showed them the road.
GENERATED_EN: and followed the small white pebbles. They sparkled like freshly minted coins and pointed the way.

FR: Les enfants marchèrent toute la nuit et,
GLOSS_LSF: ENFANT MARCHER TOUTE NUIT
EN: They walked on the whole night through,
GENERATED_EN: The children walked all night and,

FR: quand le jour se leva, ils atteignirent la maison paternelle.
GLOSS_LSF: JOUR LEVER MAISON LEUR PARENTS EUX ARRIVER
EN: and at the break of day they came to their father's house.
GENERATED_EN: When the day broke, they reached their father's house.

FR: Ils frappèrent à la porte.
GLOSS_LSF: PORTE FRAPPER
EN: They knocked at the door,
GENERATED_EN: They knocked on the door.

FR: Lorsque la femme eut ouvert et quand elle vit que c'étaient Hansel et Grethel, elle dit:
GLOSS_LSF: FEMME OUVRIR PORTE VOIR ENFANTS DIRE
GENERATED_LSF: FEMME OUVERT GRETHEL VOIR HANSEL DIRE
EN: and when the wife opened it and saw that it was Hansel and Grethel she said,
GENERATED_EN: When the woman opened the door and saw that it was Hansel and Grethel, she said:

FR: Méchants enfants! pourquoi avez-vous dormi si longtemps dans la forêt?
GLOSS_LSF: MECHANT ! POURQUOI DORMIR LONGTEMPS DANS FORET?
GENERATED_LSF: MECHANTS ENFANTS POURQUOI SI LONGTEMPS FORET AVOIR
EN: You naughty children, why did you sleep so long in the wood?
GENERATED_EN: Naughty children! Why did you sleep so long in the forest?

FR: Nous pensions que vous ne reviendriez jamais.
GLOSS_LSF: NOUS PENSER VOUS JAMAIS REVENIR
EN: we thought you were never coming home again!
GENERATED_EN: We thought you would never come back.

FR: Leur père, lui, se réjouit, car il avait le coeur lourd de les avoir laissés seuls dans la forêt.
GLOSS_LSF: LEUR PERE CONTENT PEINE TRISTE LAISSER SES ENFANTS SEUL DANS FORET
GENERATED_LSF: PERE REJOUIR COEUR LOURD SEULS FORET AVOIR LAISSES
EN: But the father was glad, for it had gone to his heart to leave them both in the woods alone.
GENERATED_EN: Their father rejoiced, for he had a heavy heart for having left them alone in the forest.

FR: Peu de temps après, la misère régna de plus belle
GLOSS_LSF: PEU TEMPS APRES MISERE RETOUR ENCORE PIRE
GENERATED_LSF: PEU TEMPS MISERE REGNA PLUS BELLE
EN: Not very long after that there was again great scarcity in those parts,
GENERATED_EN: Shortly afterwards, the misery reigned even more

FR: et les enfants entendirent ce que la marâtre disait, pendant la nuit, à son mari:
GLOSS_LSF: ENFANTS DIRE MERE DIRE PERE NUIT
GENERATED_LSF: ENFANTS MARATRE ENTENDRE DIRE NUIT MARI
EN: and the children heard their mother say at night in bed to their father,
GENERATED_EN: and the children heard what the stepmother said to her husband during the night:

FR: Il ne nous reste plus rien à manger, une demi-miche seulement,
GLOSS_LSF: PLUS NOURRITURE RESTER DEMI-MICHE UNIQUEMENT
GENERATED_LSF: NE PLUS RESTE MANGER DEMI-MICHE SEULEMENT
EN: Everything is finished up; we have only half a loaf,
GENERATED_EN: There is nothing left to eat, only half a loaf,

FR: et après, finie la chanson!
GLOSS_LSF: APRES FINI Y A PLUS
EN: and after that the tale comes to an end.
GENERATED_EN: and then the song is over!

FR: Il faut nous débarrasser des enfants; nous les conduirons encore plus profond  dans la forêt pour qu'ils ne puissent plus retrouver leur chemin; il n'y a rien d'autre à faire.
GLOSS_LSF: DEVOIR DEBARASSER ENFANTS AMENER FORET PLUS PROFOND IMPOSSIBLE RETROUVER CHEMIN PAS AUTRE SOLUTION
GENERATED_LSF: ENFANTS FALLOIR DEBARRASSER CONDUIRONS ENCORE PLUS PROFOND FORET NE PLUS CHEMIN POUVOIR RETROUVER AUTRE AVOIR FAIRE
EN: The children must be off; we will take them farther into the wood this time, so there is no other way to manage. That they shall not be able to find the way back again;
GENERATED_EN: We have to get rid of the children; we'll drive them deeper into the forest so they can't find their way back; there's nothing else to do.

FR: Le père avait bien du chagrin. Il songeait
GLOSS_LSF: PERE CHAGRIN LUI PENSER
EN: The man felt sad at heart, and he thought,
GENERATED_EN: The father was very sad. He thought of

FR: Il vaudrait mieux partager la dernière bouchée avec les enfants.
GLOSS_LSF: MIEUX PARTAGER DERNIERE NOURRITURE AVEC ENFANT
GENERATED_LSF: MIEUX DERNIERE BOUCHEE ENFANTS VALOIR PARTAGER
EN: It would better to share one's last morsel with one's children.
GENERATED_EN: It would be better to share the last bite with the children.

FR: Mais la femme ne voulut n'en entendre. Elle le gourmanda et lui fit mille reproches.
GLOSS_LSF: FEMME REFUSER GRONDER SON MARI LUI REPROCHER
GENERATED_LSF: FEMME NE VOULOIR ENTENDRE GOURMANDA FIT MILLE REPROCHES
EN: But the wife would listen to nothing that he said, but scolded and reproached him.
GENERATED_EN: But the woman did not want to hear it. She chided him and reproached him a thousand times.

FR: Qui a dit A doit dire B. Comme il avait accepté une première fois, il dut consentir derechef.
GLOSS_LSF: ACCEPTER PREMIERE FOIS PEUT PAS REFUSER DEUXIEME FOIS ALORS ENCORE ACCEPTER
GENERATED_LSF: B. PREMIERE FOIS DIT DEVOIR DIRE ACCEPTE DERECHEF DEVOIR CONSENTIR
EN: He who says A must say B too, and when a man has given in once he has to do it a second time.
GENERATED_EN: Whoever says A must say B. As he had agreed once, he had to agree again.

FR: Les enfants n'étaient pas encore endormis.
GLOSS_LSF: ENFANT PAS DORMIR
EN: But the children were not asleep,
GENERATED_EN: The children were not yet asleep.

FR: Ils avaient tout entendu.
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX TOUT ENTENDRE
EN: and had heard all the talk.
GENERATED_EN: They had heard everything.

FR: Quand les parents furent plongés dans le sommeil,
GLOSS_LSF: PARENTS S'ENDORMIR
EN: When the parents had gone to sleep
GENERATED_EN: When the parents were plunged into sleep,

FR: Hansel se leva avec l'intention d'aller ramasser des cailloux comme la fois précédente.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL LEVER VOULOIR RAMASSER CAILLOUX COMME DERNIERE FOIS
GENERATED_LSF: HANSEL INTENTION CAILLOUX FOIS PRECEDENTE LEVER ALLER RAMASSER
EN: Hansel got up to go out and get more flint stones, as he did before,
GENERATED_EN: Hansel got up with the intention of going to pick up rocks like the previous time.

FR: Mais la marâtre avait verrouillé la porte et le garçon ne put sortir.
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS SA MERE PORTE VEROUILLER GARCON NE PU SORTIR
GENERATED_LSF: MARATRE PORTE GARCON NE PUT VERROUILLE SORTIR
EN: but the wife had locked the door, and Hansel could not get out;
GENERATED_EN: But the stepmother had locked the door and the boy could not get out.

FR: Il consola cependant sa petite soeur:
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS CONSOLER SA SOEUR
EN: but he comforted his little sister,
GENERATED_EN: However, he consoled his little sister:

FR: Ne pleure pas, Grethel, dors tranquille;
GLOSS_LSF: PLEURE PAS GRETHEL DORS TRANQUILLE
EN: and said, Don't cry, Grethel, and go to sleep quietly,
GENERATED_EN: Don't cry, Grethel, sleep well;

FR: le bon Dieu nous aidera.
GLOSS_LSF: BON DEU NOUS AIDER
EN: and God will help us.
GENERATED_EN: the good Lord will help us.

FR: Tôt le matin, la marâtre fit lever les enfants.
GLOSS_LSF: MATIN TOT MERE LEVER ENFANT
GENERATED_LSF: MATIN TOT MARATRE FIT ENFANTS LEVER
EN: Early the next morning the wife came and pulled the children out of bed.
GENERATED_EN: Early in the morning, the stepmother made the children get up.

FR: Elle leur donna un morceau de pain, plus petit encore que l'autre fois.
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE DONNER MORCEAU PAIN PLUS PETIT QUE DERNIERE FOIS
GENERATED_LSF: MORCEAU PAIN DONNER PLUS PETIT ENCORE AUTRE FOIS
EN: She gave them each a little piece of bread, less than before;
GENERATED_EN: She gave them a piece of bread, even smaller than the other time.

FR: Sur la route de la forêt, Hansel l'émietta dans sa poche;
GLOSS_LSF: ROUTE FORET HANSEL EMIETTER PAIN
EN: and on the way to the wood Hansel crumbled the bread in his pocket,
GENERATED_EN: On the way to the forest, Hansel crumbled it into his pocket;

FR: il s'arrêtait souvent pour en jeter un peu sur le sol.
GLOSS_LSF: LUI S'ARRETER SOUVENT POUR JETER SOL
EN: and often stopped to throw a crumb on the ground.
GENERATED_EN: he often stopped to throw some on the ground.

FR: Hansel, qu'as-tu à t'arrêter et à regarder autour de toi? dit le père. Va ton chemin!
GLOSS_LSF: PERE DIRE HANSEL POURQUOI T'ARRETER REGARDER AUTOUR TOI ? SUIS TON CHEMIN !
GENERATED_LSF: HANSEL AS TOI T' AUTOUR TOI PERE ARRETER REGARDER DIRE CHEMIN ALLER
EN: Hansel, what are you stopping behind and staring for? said the father.
GENERATED_EN: Hansel, why do you stop and look around? Go your way!

FR: Je regarde ma petite colombe, sur le toit,
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL REPONDRE MOI REGARDER PETITE COLOMBE SUR TOIT
EN: I am looking at my little pigeon sitting on the roof,
GENERATED_EN: I look at my little dove on the roof,

FR: pour lui dire au revoir! répondit Hansel.
GLOSS_LSF: POUR DIRE AU REVOIR !
EN: to say good-bye to me, answered Hansel.
GENERATED_EN: to say goodbye!" replied Hansel.

FR: Fou! dit la femme. Ce n'est pas la colombe,
GLOSS_LSF: FEMME REPONDRE TOI FOU ! CA PAS COLOMBE
EN: You fool, said the wife, that is no pigeon,
GENERATED_EN: Crazy!" said the woman. It is not the dove,

FR: c'est le soleil qui se joue sur la cheminée.
GLOSS_LSF: CA PAS COLOMBE CHEMINE REFLET SOLEIL
EN: but the morning sun shining on the chimney pots.
GENERATED_EN: it is the sun that plays on the fireplace.

FR: Hansel, cependant, continuait à semer des miettes de pain le long du chemin.
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS HANSEL QUAND MEME CONTINUER MIETTE PAIN SEMER CHEMIN
GENERATED_LSF: HANSEL CEPENDANT MIETTES PAIN LONG CHEMIN CONTINUER SEMER
EN: Hansel went on as before, and strewed bread crumbs all along the road.
GENERATED_EN: Hansel, however, continued to scatter breadcrumbs along the path.

FR: La marâtre conduisit les enfants au fin fond de la forêt,
GLOSS_LSF: MERE AMENER ENFANT FON FORET
GENERATED_LSF: MARATRE ENFANTS FIN FOND FORET CONDUIRE
EN: The woman led the children far into the wood,
GENERATED_EN: The stepmother led the children deep into the forest,

FR: plus loin qu'ils n'étaient jamais allés.
GLOSS_LSF: JAMAIS ALLER LA TELLEMENT LOIN
EN: where they had never been before in all their lives.
GENERATED_EN: further than they had ever gone before.

FR: On y refit un grand feu et la femme dit:
GLOSS_LSF: REFAIRE GRAND FEU FEMME DIRE
EN: And again there was a large fire made, and the mother said,
GENERATED_EN: A big fire was built and the woman said:

FR: Restez là, les enfants.
GLOSS_LSF: VOUS RESTER ICI
EN: Sit still there, you children, and when you are tired you can go to sleep;
GENERATED_EN: Stay there, kids.

FR: Quand vous serez fatigués, vous pourrez dormir un peu nous allons couper du ce soir, quand nous aurons fini, nous viendrons vous chercher. bois et,
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND VOUS FATIGUER POUVOIR DORMIR NOUS COUPER BOIS POUR CE SOIR QUAND NOUS FINIR NOUS VENIR VOUS CHERCHER
GENERATED_LSF: ETRE FATIGUES PEU SOIR DORMIR ALLER COUPER FINI VENIR CHERCHER BOIS
EN: we are going into the forest to cut wood, and in the evening, when we are ready to go home we will come and fetch you.
GENERATED_EN: When you are tired, you can sleep a little we will cut some tonight, when we finish, we will come to get you. wood and,

FR: À midi, Grethel partagea son pain avec Hansel qui avait éparpillé le sien le long du chemin.
GLOSS_LSF: MIDI GRETHEL PARTAGER SON PAIN AVEC HANSEL PAR LUI EPARPILLER SUR CHEMIN
GENERATED_LSF: MIDI GRETHEL PARTAGEA PAIN HANSEL SIEN LONG CHEMIN EPARPILLE
EN: So when noon came Grethel shared her bread with Hansel, who had strewed his along the road.
GENERATED_EN: At noon, Grethel shared her bread with Hansel, who had scattered hers along the path.

FR: Puis ils dormirent
GLOSS_LSF: ENSUITE DORMIR
EN: Then they went to sleep,
GENERATED_EN: Then they slept

FR: et la soirée passa sans que personne ne revînt auprès d'eux.
GLOSS_LSF: SOIREE PERSONNE REVENIR
GENERATED_LSF: SOIREE NE AUPRES PASSA PERSONNE REVENIR
EN: and the evening passed, and no one came for the poor children.
GENERATED_EN: and the evening passed without anyone coming back to them.

FR: Ils s'éveillèrent au milieu de la nuit,
GLOSS_LSF: NUIT S'EVEILLER
EN: When they awoke it was dark night,
GENERATED_EN: They woke up in the middle of the night,

FR: et Hansel consola sa petite soeur, disant:
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL CONSOLER SA SOEUR LUI DIRE
EN: and Hansel comforted his little sister,
GENERATED_EN: and Hansel comforted his little sister, saying:

FR: Attends que la lune se lève, Grethel, nous verrons les miettes de pain que j'ai jetées; elles nous montreront le chemin de la maison.
GLOSS_LSF: ATTEND LUNE CIEL LEVER NOUS VOIR MIETTE PAIN MOI JETER ELLES MONTRER NOUS CHEMIN RENTRER MAISON
GENERATED_LSF: ATTENDS LUNE LEVER GRETHEL MIETTES PAIN VOIR JETEES CHEMIN MAISON MONTRER
EN: and said, Wait a little, Grethel, until the moon gets up, then we shall be able to see the way home by the crumbs of bread that I have scattered along it.
GENERATED_EN: Wait until the moon rises, Grethel, and we'll see the breadcrumbs I threw away; they'll show us the way home.

FR: Quand la lune se leva, ils se mirent en route. Mais de miettes, point.
GLOSS_LSF: LUNE LEVER TOUS DEUX MARCHER  MAIS PAS DE MIETTE
GENERATED_LSF: LUNE LEVER ROUTE METTRE MIETTES POINT
EN: So when the moon rose they got up, but they could find no crumbs of bread,
GENERATED_EN: When the moon rose, they set off. But no crumbs.

FR: Les mille oiseaux des champs et des bois les avaient mangées.
GLOSS_LSF: TOUS OISEAUX CHAMPS BOIS MANGER MIETTES
EN: for the birds of the woods and of the fields had come and picked them up.
GENERATED_EN: The thousand birds of the fields and woods had eaten them.

FR: Les deux enfants marchèrent toute la nuit et le jour suivant,
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX ENFANTS MARCHER TOUTE NUIT LENDEMAIN TOUTE JOURNEE
GENERATED_LSF: DEUX ENFANTS TOUTE NUIT JOUR SUIVANT MARCHER
EN: They went on all that night, and the next day from the morning until the evening,
GENERATED_EN: The two children walked all night and the next day,

FR: sans trouver à sortir de la forêt.
GLOSS_LSF: IMPOSSIBLE TROUVER SORTIE FORET
EN: but they could not find the way out of the wood,
GENERATED_EN: without finding a way out of the forest.

FR: Ils mouraient de faim, n'ayant à se mettre sous la dent que quelques baies sauvages.
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX MOURIR FAIM RIEN MANGER SAUF BAIES SAUVAGE
GENERATED_LSF: MOURAIENT FAIM DENT BAIES SAUVAGES AYANT METTRE
EN: and they were very hungry, for they had nothing to eat but the few berries they could pick up.
GENERATED_EN: They were starving, having only a few wild berries to eat.

FR: Ils étaient si fatigués que leurs jambes ne voulaient plus les porter. Ils se couchèrent au pied d'un arbre et s'endormirent.
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX TRES FATIGUER JAMBES EPUISE PAS MARCHER ARBRE PIED S'ALLONGER S'ENDORMIR
GENERATED_LSF: JAMBES NE PLUS FATIGUES VOULOIR PORTER PIED ARBRE COUCHER ENDORMIR
EN: And when they were so tired that they could no longer drag themselves along, they lay down under a tree and fell asleep.
GENERATED_EN: They were so tired that their legs wouldn't carry them anymore. They lay down at the foot of a tree and fell asleep.

FR: Trois jours s'étaient déjà passés depuis qu'ils avaient quitté la maison paternelle.
GLOSS_LSF: TROIS JOUR DEJA DEPUIS QUITTER MAISON
GENERATED_LSF: TROIS JOURS DEJA MAISON PATERNELLE PASSES QUITTE
EN: It was now the third morning since they had left their father's house.
GENERATED_EN: Three days had already passed since they had left their father's house.

FR: Ils continuaient à marcher, s'enfonçant toujours plus avant dans la forêt.
GLOSS_LSF: CONTINUER MARCHER FORET S'ENFONCER ENCORE PLUS
GENERATED_LSF: CONTINUAIENT MARCHER TOUJOURS PLUS FORET ENFONCANT
EN: They were always trying to get back to it, but instead of that they only found themselves farther in the wood,
GENERATED_EN: They kept walking, going deeper and deeper into the forest.

FR: Si personne n'allait venir à leur aide, ils ne tarderaient pas à mourir.
GLOSS_LSF: SI PERSONNE AIDER EUX EUX BIENTOT MOURIR
GENERATED_LSF: AIDE PERSONNE ALLER VENIR NE PAS TARDER MOURIR
EN: and if help had not soon come they would have been starved.
GENERATED_EN: If no one came to their aid, they would soon die.

FR: A midi, ils virent un joli oiseau sur une branche, blanc comme neige.
GLOSS_LSF: MIDI VOIR BEAU OISEAU SUR BRANCHE BLANC COMME NEIGE
GENERATED_LSF: MIDI JOLI OISEAU BRANCHE VOIR BLANC NEIGE
EN: About noon they saw a pretty snow-white bird sitting on a bough,
GENERATED_EN: At noon, they saw a pretty bird on a branch, white as snow.

FR: Il chantait si bien que les enfants s'arrêtèrent pour l'écouter.
GLOSS_LSF: OISEAU CHANTER BIEN ENFANTS S'ARRETER L'ECOUTER
EN: and singing so sweetly that they stopped to listen.
GENERATED_EN: He sang so well that the children stopped to listen.

FR: Quand il eut fini, il déploya ses ailes et vola devant eux.
GLOSS_LSF: OISEAU FINIR CHANTER DEPLOYER AILE S'ENVOLER
EN: And when he had finished the bird spread his wings and flew before them,
GENERATED_EN: When he finished, he spread his wings and flew in front of them.

FR: Ils le suivirent jusqu'à une petite maison sur le toit de laquelle le bel oiseau blanc se percha.
GLOSS_LSF: ENFANTS LE SUIVRE JUSQU’A PETITE MAISON BEL OISEAU BLANC SE PERCHER TOIT
GENERATED_LSF: PETITE MAISON TOIT BEL OISEAU BLANC SUIVRE PERCHER
EN: and they followed after him until they came to a little house, and the bird perched on the roof,
GENERATED_EN: They followed him to a small house on whose roof the beautiful white bird perched.

FR: Quand ils s'en furent approchés tout près, ils virent qu'elle était faite de pain et recouverte de gâteaux.
GLOSS_LSF: ENFANTS APPROCHER VOIR MAISON CONSTRUITE PAIN RECOUVERT GATEAU
GENERATED_LSF: TOUT PRES APPROCHES PAIN RECOUVERTE GATEAUX VOIR FAITE
EN: and when they came nearer they saw that the house was built of bread, and roofed with cakes;
GENERATED_EN: When they got close to it, they saw that it was made of bread and covered with cakes.

FR: Les fenêtres étaient en sucre.
GLOSS_LSF: FENETRE SUCRE
EN: and the window was of transparent sugar.
GENERATED_EN: The windows were made of sugar.

FR: Nous allons nous mettre au travail, dit Hansel, et faire un repas béni de Dieu.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL DIRE ALLER TRAVAIL NOUS PREPARER DELICIEUX REPAS DIEU BENIR NOUS
GENERATED_LSF: TRAVAIL ALLER METTRE HANSEL DIRE REPAS BENI DIEU FAIRE
EN: We will have some of this, said Hansel, and make a fine meal.
GENERATED_EN: We'll get to work," said Hansel, "and make a meal blessed by God.

FR: Je mangerai un morceau du toit, Grethel;
GLOSS_LSF: MOI MANGER MORCEAU TOIT
EN: I will eat a piece of the roof, Grethel,
GENERATED_EN: I'll eat a piece of the roof, Grethel;

FR: Et tu peux avoir un morceau de la fenêtre, elle est si bonne.
GLOSS_LSF: TOI PREND MORCEAU FENETRE BONNE
GENERATED_LSF: TOI MORCEAU FENETRE POUVOIR AVOIR SI BONNE
EN: and you can have some of the window-that will taste sweet.
GENERATED_EN: And you can have a piece of the window, it's so good.

FR: Hansel grimpa sur le toit et en arracha un petit morceau pour goûter.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL TOIT GRIMPER ARRACHER MORCEAU POUR GOUTER
GENERATED_LSF: HANSEL GRIMPA TOIT PETIT MORCEAU GOUTER ARRACHA
EN: So Hansel reached up and broke off a bit of the roof, just to see how it tasted,
GENERATED_EN: Hansel climbed onto the roof and took a small piece to taste.

FR: Grethel se mit à lécher les carreaux.
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL FENETRE LECHER
EN: and Grethel stood by the window and gnawed at it.
GENERATED_EN: Grethel began to lick the tiles.

FR: On entendit alors une voix suave qui venait de la chambre
GLOSS_LSF: D'UN COUP ENTENDRE VOIX DOUCE VENIR CHAMBRE
GENERATED_LSF: ALORS VOIX SUAVE CHAMBRE ENTENDRE VENIR
EN: Then they heard a thin voice call out from inside,
GENERATED_EN: Then a sweet voice was heard coming from the room

FR: Grignoter, grignoter, comme une souris,
GLOSS_LSF: VOIX DIRE GRIGNOTER GRIGNOTER COMME SOURIS
EN: Nibble, nibble, like a mouse,
GENERATED_EN: Nibble, nibble, like a mouse,

FR: Qui donc grignote ma maison ?
GLOSS_LSF: QUI GRIGNOTE MA MAISON ?
EN: Who is nibbling at my house?
GENERATED_EN: Who's eating away at my house?

FR: Les enfants répondirent
GLOSS_LSF: ENFANTS REPONDRE
EN: And the children answered,
GENERATED_EN: The children replied

FR: Oubliez, c'est le vent.
GLOSS_LSF: NON NON VENT
EN: Never mind, It is the wind.
GENERATED_EN: Forget it, it's the wind.

FR: Et ils continuèrent à manger sans se laisser détourner de leur tâche.
GLOSS_LSF: CONTINUER MANGER SANS PERTUBER
EN: And they went on eating, never disturbing themselves.
GENERATED_EN: And they continued to eat without being diverted from their task.

FR: Hansel, qui trouvait le toit fort bon, en fit tomber un gros morceau par terre
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL ADORER TOIT DELICIEUX MORCEAU TOMBER
GENERATED_LSF: HANSEL TOIT FORT BON TROUVER FIT GROS MORCEAU TERRE TOMBER
EN: Hansel, who found that the roof tasted very nice, took down a great piece of it,
GENERATED_EN: Hansel, who thought the roof was very good, dropped a large piece of it on the ground

FR: et Grethel découpa une vitre entière, s'assit sur le sol et se mit à manger.
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL VITRE DECOUPER SOL S'ASSOIR MANGER
GENERATED_LSF: GRETHEL VITRE ENTIERE DECOUPER SOL ASSEOIR METTRE MANGER
EN: and Grethel pulled out a large round window-pane, and sat her down and began upon it.
GENERATED_EN: and Grethel cut out a whole window, sat down on the floor and began to eat.

FR: La porte, tout à coup s'ouvrit
GLOSS_LSF: D'UN COUP PORTE OUVRIR
EN: Then the door opened,
GENERATED_EN: The door suddenly opened

FR: et une femme, vieille comme les pierres, s'appuyant sur une canne, sortit de la maison.
GLOSS_LSF: FEMME VIEILLE COMME PIERRE CANNE S'APPUYER MAISON SORTIR
GENERATED_LSF: FEMME VIEILLE PIERRES CANNE APPUYANT MAISON SORTIR
EN: and an aged woman came out, leaning upon a crutch.
GENERATED_EN: and a woman, old as stones, leaning on a cane, came out of the house.

FR: Hansel et Grethel eurent si peur qu'ils laissèrent tomber tout ce qu'ils tenaient dans leurs mains.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL GRETHEL PEUR MAIN TOUT TOMBER
GENERATED_LSF: HANSEL GRETHEL EURENT PEUR TOUT MAINS LAISSER TOMBER TENIR
EN: Hansel and Grethel felt very frightened, and let fall what they had in their hands.
GENERATED_EN: Hansel and Grethel were so frightened that they dropped everything in their hands.

FR: La vieille secoua la tête et dit:
GLOSS_LSF: VIEILLE SECOUER TETE DIRE
EN: The old woman, however, nodded her head, and said,
GENERATED_EN: The old woman shook her head and said:

FR: Eh! chers enfants, qui vous a conduits ici?
GLOSS_LSF: EH ENFANTS COMMENT VOUS VENIR ICI ?
EN: Ah, my dear children, how come you here?
GENERATED_EN: Hey, dear children, who brought you here?

FR: Entrez, venez chez moi!
GLOSS_LSF: ENTREZ VENEZ CHEZ MOI !
EN: you must come indoors and stay with me,
GENERATED_EN: Come in, come to my house!

FR: Il ne vous sera fait aucun mal.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI MAL VOUS JAMAIS
EN: you will be no trouble.
GENERATED_EN: No harm will come to you.

FR: Elle les prit tous deux par la main
GLOSS_LSF: PRENDRE DEUX MAINS
EN: So she took them each by the hand,
GENERATED_EN: She took them both by the hand

FR: et les fit entrer dans la maisonnette.
GLOSS_LSF: MAISONNETTE ENTRER
EN: and led them into her little house.
GENERATED_EN: and brought them into the cottage.

FR: Elle leur servit un bon repas, du lait et des beignets avec du sucre, des pommes et des noix.
GLOSS_LSF: DAME SERVIR REPAS BON LAIT BEIGNET AVEC SUCRE POMME NOIX
GENERATED_LSF: SERVIT BON REPAS LAIT BEIGNETS SUCRE POMMES NOIX
EN: And there they found a good meal laid out, of milk and pancakes, with sugar, apples, and nuts.
GENERATED_EN: She served them a good meal, milk and doughnuts with sugar, apples and nuts.

FR: Elle prépara ensuite deux petits lits.
GLOSS_LSF: PREPARER DEUX PETITS LITS
EN: After that she showed them two little white beds,
GENERATED_EN: She then prepared two small beds.

FR: Hansel et Grethel s'y couchèrent.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL GRETHEL SE COUCHER
EN: and Hansel and Grethel laid themselves down on them,
GENERATED_EN: Hansel and Grethel went to bed.

FR: Ils se croyaient au Paradis.
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX ENFANT CROIRE PARADIS
EN: and thought they were in heaven.
GENERATED_EN: They thought they were in heaven.

FR: Mais l'amitié de la vieille n'était qu'apparente.
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS VIEILLE MONTRER GENTILLE AMIE MAIS FAUX
EN: The old woman, although her behaviour was so kind,
GENERATED_EN: But the old woman's friendship was only apparent.

FR: En réalité, c'était une méchante sorcière à l'affût des enfants.
GLOSS_LSF: VRAI ELLE MECHANTE SORCIERE CHERCHER ENFANT
EN: was a wicked witch, who lay in wait for children,
GENERATED_EN: In reality, she was a wicked witch on the lookout for children.

FR: Elle n'avait construit la maison de pain que pour les attirer.
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE CONSTRUIRE MAISON PAIN EXPRES ATTIRER
EN: and had built the little house on purpose to entice them.
GENERATED_EN: She had built the bread house only to attract them.

FR: Quand elle en prenait un, elle le tuait, le faisait cuire et le mangeait.
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND REUSSIR ATTRAPER UN ENFANT TUER CUIRE ENFANT MANGER
EN: When they were once inside she used to kill them, cook them, and eat them,
GENERATED_EN: When she caught one, she killed it, cooked it and ate it.

FR: Pour elle, c'était alors jour de fête.
GLOSS_LSF: ALORS AUJOURD'HUI FETE POUR ELLE
EN: and then it was a feast day with her.
GENERATED_EN: For her, it was a day of celebration.

FR: La sorcière avait les yeux rouges et elle ne voyait pas très clair.
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIERE YEUX ROUGE PAS BIEN VOIR
GENERATED_LSF: SORCIERE YEUX ROUGES NE PAS TRES CLAIR VOIR
EN: The witch's eyes were red, and she could not see very far, but she had a keen scent, like the beasts,
GENERATED_EN: The witch's eyes were red and she couldn't see very clearly.

FR: Mais elle avait un instinct très sûr, comme les bêtes, et sentait venir de loin les êtres humains.
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS INSTINCT SUR COMME ANIMAUX SENTIR HUMAIN DE LOIN
GENERATED_LSF: INSTINCT TRES SUR AVOIR BETES LOIN ETRES HUMAINS SENTIR VENIR
EN: and knew very well when human creatures were near.
GENERATED_EN: But she had a very sure instinct, like the beasts, and could sense human beings coming from afar.

FR: Quand Hansel et Grethel s'étaient approchés de sa demeure, elle avait ri méchamment et dit d'une voix mielleuse:
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND HANSEL GRETHEL APPROCHER SA MAISON ELLE RIRE MECHAMMENT DIRE VOIX DOUCE
GENERATED_LSF: HANSEL GRETHEL DEMEURE APPROCHES MECHAMMENT VOIX MIELLEUSE DIT
EN: When she knew that Hansel and Grethel were coming, she gave a spiteful laugh, and said triumphantly,
GENERATED_EN: When Hansel and Grethel had approached her home, she had laughed wickedly and said in a honeyed voice:

FR: Ceux-là, je les tiens! Il ne faudra pas qu'ils m'échappent!
GLOSS_LSF: CES ENFANTS MOI TENIR ATTENTION PAS ECHAPPER
EN: I have them, and they shall not escape me!
GENERATED_EN: I've got them! They must not escape me!

FR: A l'aube, avant que les enfants ne se soient éveillés, elle se leva.
GLOSS_LSF: SOLEIL LEVER ENFANT PAS ENCORE REVEILLER DAME SE LEVER
EN: Early in the morning, before the children were awake, she got up to look at them,
GENERATED_EN: At dawn, before the children were awake, she got up.

FR: Quand elle les vit qui reposaient si gentiment, avec leurs bonnes joues toutes roses,
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE VOIR ENFANTS SE REPOSER SEREIN GROSSE JOUE ROSE
GENERATED_LSF: GENTIMENT VOIR REPOSER BONNES JOUES TOUTES ROSES
EN: and as they lay sleeping so peacefully with round rosy cheeks,
GENERATED_EN: When she saw them resting so nicely, with their good pink cheeks,

FR: elle murmura:
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE CHUCHOTER
EN: she said to herself,
GENERATED_EN: she murmured:

FR: Quel bon repas je vais faire!
GLOSS_LSF: HMM BON REPAS MOI PREPARER
EN: What a fine feast I shall have!
GENERATED_EN: What a great meal I'm going to make!

FR: Elle attrapa Hansel de sa main rêche,
GLOSS_LSF: VIEILLLE ATTRAPER FORTEMENT HANSEL
EN: Then she grasped Hansel with her withered hand,
GENERATED_EN: She grabbed Hansel with her rough hand,

FR: le conduisit dans une petite étable
GLOSS_LSF: AMENER DANS PETITE ETABLE
EN: and led him into a little stable,
GENERATED_EN: led him to a small stable

FR: et l'y enferma au verrou.
GLOSS_LSF: ENFERMER FERMER CLE
EN: and shut him up behind a grating;
GENERATED_EN: and locked him in.

FR: Il eut beau crier, cela ne lui servit à rien.
GLOSS_LSF: GARCON CRIER CRIER PAS LA PEINE
EN: and call and scream as he might, it was no good.
GENERATED_EN: He shouted, but it was no use.

FR: La sorcière s'approcha ensuite de Grethel, la secoua pour la réveiller et s'écria:
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIERE APPROCHER GRETHEL SECOUER REVEILLER DAME CRIER
GENERATED_LSF: SORCIERE APPROCHA ENSUITE GRETHEL SECOUA REVEILLER ECRIA
EN: Then she went back to Grethel and shook her, crying,  water,
GENERATED_EN: The witch then approached Grethel, shook her awake and cried out:

FR: Debout, paresseuse!
GLOSS_LSF: DEBOUT DEBOUT PARESSEUSE
EN: Get up, lazy bones;
GENERATED_EN: Get up, lazybones!

FR: Va chercher de l'eau et prépare quelque chose de bon à manger pour ton frère.
GLOSS_LSF: CHERCHER EAU PREPARER BON REPAS POUR TON FRERE
GENERATED_LSF: EAU CHOSE BON TON FRERE ALLER CHERCHER PREPARE MANGER
EN: fetch and cook something nice for your brother;
GENERATED_EN: Go get some water and prepare something good to eat for your brother.

FR: Il est enfermé à l'étable et il faut qu'il engraisse.
GLOSS_LSF: ETABLE LUI ENFERMER FAUT L'ENGRAISSER
EN: he is outside in the stable, and must be fattened up.
GENERATED_EN: He is locked up in the barn and has to fatten up.

FR: Quand il sera à point, je le mangerai.
GLOSS_LSF: QUAND PRET MOI MANGER LUI
EN: And when he is fat enough I will eat him.
GENERATED_EN: When it is ready, I will eat it.

FR: Grethel se mit à pleurer, mais cela ne lui servit à rien.
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL PLEURER MAIS PAS LA PEINE
EN: Grethel began to weep bitterly, but it was of no use,
GENERATED_EN: Grethel began to cry, but it did her no good.

FR: Elle fut obligée de faire ce que lui demandait l'ogresse.
GLOSS_LSF: OBLIGER ECOUTER FAIRE ORDRE MECHANTE DAME
EN: she had to do what the wicked witch bade her.
GENERATED_EN: She was forced to do what the ogress asked her to do.

FR: On prépara pour le pauvre Hansel les plats les plus délicats.
GLOSS_LSF: PREPARER POUR HANSEL REPAS DELICIEUX
GENERATED_LSF: PAUVRE HANSEL PLATS PLUS DELICATS PREPARER
EN: And so the best kind of victuals was cooked for poor Hansel,
GENERATED_EN: The most delicate dishes were prepared for poor Hansel.

FR: Grethel, elle, n'eut droit qu'à des carapaces de crabes.
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL ELLE POUVOIR MANGER CRABE CARAPACE
EN: while Grethel got nothing but crab-shells.
GENERATED_EN: Grethel, on the other hand, was only given crab shells.

FR: Tous les matins, la vieille se glissait jusqu'à l'écurie
GLOSS_LSF: TOUS LES MATINS VIEILLE ALLER DANS ECURIE
EN: Each morning the old woman visited the little stable,
GENERATED_EN: Every morning, the old woman would slip away to the stable

FR: et disait: Hansel, tends tes doigts, que je voie si tu es déjà assez gras.
GLOSS_LSF: DIRE HANSEL MONTRER TES DOIGTS MOI VOIR SI DEJA SUFFISAMENT GRAS
GENERATED_LSF: DIRE HANSEL TENDS TES DOIGTS TOI DEJA ASSEZ GRAS VOIR
EN: and cried, Hansel, stretch out your finger, that I may tell if you will soon be fat enough.
GENERATED_EN: and said: Hansel, hold out your fingers so I can see if you are already fat enough.

FR: Mais Hansel tendait un petit os
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL MONTRER PETIT OS
EN: Hansel, however, used to hold out a little bone,
GENERATED_EN: But Hansel held out a small bone

FR: et la sorcière, qui avait de mauvais yeux, ne s'en rendait pas compte.
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIERE YEUX MAUVAIS VOIR MAL PAS SE RENDRE COMPTE
GENERATED_LSF: SORCIERE MAUVAIS YEUX NE PAS COMPTE RENDRE
EN: and the old woman, who had weak eyes, could not see what it was,
GENERATED_EN: and the witch, who had bad eyes, did not realize it.

FR: Elle croyait que c'était vraiment le doigt de Hansel et s'étonnait qu'il n'engraissât point.
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE CROIRE OS VRAIMENT DOIGT DE HANSEL ELLE SURPRISE LUI PAS GROSSIR
GENERATED_LSF: VRAIMENT DOIGT HANSEL POINT CROIRE ETONNER ENGRAISSAT
EN: and supposing it to be Hansel's finger, wondered very much that it was not getting fatter.
GENERATED_EN: She thought it was really Hansel's finger and was surprised that it didn't get fat.

FR: Quand quatre semaines furent passées, et que l'enfant était toujours aussi maigre,
GLOSS_LSF: QUATRE SEMAINE PASSER DEJA ENFANT TOUJOURS MAIGRE
GENERATED_LSF: QUATRE SEMAINES PASSEES ENFANT TOUJOURS AUSSI MAIGRE
EN: When four weeks had passed and Hansel seemed to remain so thin,
GENERATED_EN: When four weeks had passed, and the child was still thin,

FR: she lost patience and could wait no longer.
GLOSS_LSF: PAS PATIENTE ELLE PAS POUVOIR ATTENDRE
GENERATED_LSF: SHE LOST PATIENCE COULD WER LONGER
EN: elle perdit patience et décida de ne pas attendre plus longtemps.
GENERATED_EN: she lost patience and could wait no longer.

FR: Holà! Grethel, cria-t-elle à la petite fille,
GLOSS_LSF: VIELLE DAME CRIER BONJOUR GRETHEL
EN: Now then, Grethel, cried she to the little girl;
GENERATED_EN: Whoa! Grethel," she called out to the little girl,

FR: dépêche-toi d'apporter de l'eau.
GLOSS_LSF: VITE VITE APPORTER MOI EAU
EN: be quick and draw water;
GENERATED_EN: hurry up and bring some water.

FR: Que Hansel soit gras ou maigre, c'est demain que je le tuerai et le mangerai.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL GROS MAIGRE TANT PIS DEMAIN MOI TUER LUI MANGER
GENERATED_LSF: HANSEL GRAS MAIGRE DEMAIN TUERAI MANGERAI
EN: be Hansel fat or be he lean, tomorrow I must kill and cook him.
GENERATED_EN: Whether Hansel is fat or thin, I will kill and eat him tomorrow.

FR: Ah, comme elle pleurait, la pauvre petite, en charriant ses seaux d'eau,
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL PLEURER PLEURER ELLE PORTER SEAUX EAU
GENERATED_LSF: AH PLEURER PAUVRE PETITE SEAUX EAU CHARRIANT
EN: Oh what a grief for the poor little sister to have to fetch water,
GENERATED_EN: Ah, how she cried, the poor little girl, while carrying her buckets of water,

FR: comme les larmes coulaient le long de ses joues!
GLOSS_LSF: PAR PLEURER EAU COULER COULER JOUES !
EN: and how the tears flowed down over her cheeks!
GENERATED_EN: how the tears flowed down her cheeks!

FR: Dieu bon, aide-nous donc! s'écria-t-elle.
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL CRIER BON DIEU TOI AIDER NOUS !
EN: Dear God, pray help us! cried she;
GENERATED_EN: Good God, help us!" she cried.

FR: Si seulement les bêtes de la forêt nous avaient dévorés! Au moins serions-nous morts ensemble!
GLOSS_LSF: SI ANIMAUX FORET MANGER NOUS MIEUX NOUS DEUX MORT ENSEMBLE
GENERATED_LSF: SEULEMENT BETES FORET MOINS SERIONS ENSEMBLE DEVORES MORTS
EN: if we had been devoured by wild beasts in the wood at least we should have died together.
GENERATED_EN: If only the beasts of the forest had devoured us! At least we would have died together!

FR: Cesse de te lamenter! dit la vieille;
GLOSS_LSF: VIEILLE DIRE OH ARRETER PLEURER
EN: Spare me your lamentations, said the old woman;
GENERATED_EN: Stop complaining!" said the old woman;

FR: ça ne te servira à rien!
GLOSS_LSF: SERVIR A RIEN !
EN: they are of no avail.
GENERATED_EN: It won't do you any good!

FR: De bon matin, Grethel fut chargée de remplir la grande marmite d'eau et d'allumer le feu.
GLOSS_LSF: MATIN GRETHEL RESPONSABLE REMPLIR MARMITE EAU ALLUMER FEU
GENERATED_LSF: BON MATIN GRETHEL GRANDE MARMITE EAU FEU CHARGEE REMPLIR ALLUMER
EN: Early next morning Grethel had to get up, make the fire, and fill the kettle.
GENERATED_EN: Early in the morning, Grethel was asked to fill the large pot with water and light the fire.

FR: Nous allons d'abord faire la pâte, dit la sorcière.
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIERE DIRE D'ABORD CUIRE PATE
GENERATED_LSF: ABORD PATE ALLER FAIRE SORCIERE DIRE
EN: First we will do the baking, said the old woman;  already,
GENERATED_EN: We'll make the dough first," said the witch.

FR: J'ai déjà fait chauffer le four et préparé ce qu'il faut.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI DEJA CHAUFFER FOUR TOUT PRÊT
EN: I nave heated the oven and kneaded the dough.
GENERATED_EN: I've already heated up the oven and prepared what I need.

FR: Elle poussa la pauvre Grethel vers le four, d'où sortaient de grandes flammes.
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIERE POUSSER GRETHEL A COTE FOUR GRANDE FLAMME SORTIR
GENERATED_LSF: PAUVRE GRETHEL FOUR POUSSER GRANDES FLAMMES SORTIR
EN: She pushed poor Grethel towards the oven, out of which the flames were already shining.
GENERATED_EN: She pushed poor Grethel towards the oven, from which great flames were coming out.

FR: Faufile-toi dedans! ordonna-t-elle, et vois s'il est assez chaud pour la cuisson.
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIERE ORDONNER GRETHEL TOI ALLER DEDANS VERIFIER SI ASSEZ CHAUD POUR CUISSON
GENERATED_LSF: FAUFILE TOI DEDANS ORDONNER ASSEZ CHAUD CUISSON VOIR
EN: Creep in, said the witch, and see if it is properly hot, so that the bread may be baked.
GENERATED_EN: Slip into it!" she ordered, and see if it's hot enough to cook.

FR: Elle avait l'intention de fermer le four quand la petite y serait pour la faire rôtir.
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIER IDEE QUAND FILLE DEDANS FERMER FOUR POUR ROTIR
GENERATED_LSF: INTENTION FOUR PETITE AVOIR FERMER ROTIR
EN: And Grethel once in, she meant to shut the door upon her and let her be baked,
GENERATED_EN: She intended to close the oven when the child was in it to roast her.

FR: Elle voulait la manger, elle aussi.
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIERE VOULOIR MANGER FILLE AUSSI
EN: and then she would have eaten her.
GENERATED_EN: She wanted to eat it, too.

FR: Mais Grethel devina son projet
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL DEVINER SON IDEE
EN: But Grethel perceived her intention,
GENERATED_EN: But Grethel guessed his plan

FR: et dit: Je ne sais comment faire , comment entre-t-on dans ce four?
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL REPONDRE MOI SAIT PAS COMMENT FAIRE COMMENT ENTRER DANS FOUR ?
GENERATED_LSF: DIT NE COMMENT SAVOIR FAIRE COMMENT FOUR ENTRE-T-ON
EN: and said, I don't know how to do it: how shall I get in?
GENERATED_EN: and said: I don't know how to do it, how do I get into this oven?

FR: Petite oie, dit la sorcière,
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIERE DIRE IDIOTE
EN: Stupid goose, said the old woman,
GENERATED_EN: Little goose, said the witch,

FR: l'ouverture est assez grande, vois,
GLOSS_LSF: OUVERTURE ASSEZ GRANDE REGARDE
EN: the opening is big enough, do you see?
GENERATED_EN: the opening is quite large, see,

FR: je pourrais y entrer moi-même.
GLOSS_LSF: MOI POUVOIR ENTRER DEDANS
EN: I could get in myself!
GENERATED_EN: I could enter it myself.

FR: Et elle y passa la tête.
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIERE TETE PASSER
EN: and she stooped down and put her head in the oven's mouth.
GENERATED_EN: And she stuck her head in.

FR: Alors Grethel la poussa vivement dans le four, claqua la porte et mit le verrou.
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL POUSSER FORT DANS FOUR CLAQUER PORTE FERMER VERROU
GENERATED_LSF: ALORS GRETHEL POUSSA VIVEMENT FOUR CLAQUA PORTE VERROU METTRE
EN: Then Grethel gave her a push, so that she went in farther, and she shut theand put up the bar iron door upon her,
GENERATED_EN: Then Grethel pushed her briskly into the oven, slammed the door and locked it.

FR: La sorcière se mit à hurler épouvantablement.
GLOSS_LSF: SORCIER HURLER
EN: Oh how frightfully she howled!
GENERATED_EN: The witch began to scream terribly.

FR: Mais Grethel s'en alla et cette épouvantable sorcière n'eut plus qu'à rôtir.
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL S'ECHAPPER HORRIBLE SORCIERE RESTER ROTIR
GENERATED_LSF: GRETHEL EPOUVANTABLE SORCIERE PLUS ALLER AVOIR ROTIR
EN: but Grethel ran away, and left the wicked witch to burn miserably.
GENERATED_EN: But Grethel went away, and the dreadful witch had only to roast.

FR: Grethel, elle, courut aussi vite qu'elle le pouvait chez Hansel.
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL COURIR VITE VITE PLUS VITE ELLE POUVOIR REJOINDRE HANSEL
GENERATED_LSF: GRETHEL COURUT AUSSI VITE HANSEL POUVOIR
EN: Grethel went straight to Hansel,
GENERATED_EN: Grethel ran as fast as she could to Hansel.

FR: Elle ouvrit la petite étable et dit:
GLOSS_LSF: OUVRIR ETABLE ELLE DIRE
EN: opened the stable-door,
GENERATED_EN: She opened the little stable and said:

FR: Hansel, nous sommes libres!
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL NOUS LIBRE
EN: and cried, Hansel, we are free!
GENERATED_EN: Hansel, we are free!

FR: La vieille sorcière est morte!
GLOSS_LSF: VIEILLE SORCIERE MORTE
EN: the old witch is dead!
GENERATED_EN: The old witch is dead!

FR: Hansel bondit hors de sa prison, aussi rapide qu'un oiseau dont on vient d'ouvrir la cage.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL SORTIR SA PRISON COMME OISEAU SORTIR SA CAGE
GENERATED_LSF: HANSEL PRISON BONDIR AUSSI RAPIDE OISEAU CAGE VENIR OUVRIR
EN: Then out flew Hansel like a bird from its cage as soon as the door is opened.
GENERATED_EN: Hansel leaps out of his prison, as fast as a bird whose cage has just been opened.

FR: Comme ils étaient heureux!
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX HEUREUX
EN: How rejoiced they both were! how
GENERATED_EN: How happy they were!

FR: Comme ils se prirent par le cou,
GLOSS_LSF: CALIN
EN: they fell each on the other's neck!
GENERATED_EN: As they grabbed each other by the neck,

FR: dansèrent et s'embrassèrent!
GLOSS_LSF: DANSER S'EMBRASSER
EN: and danced about, and kissed each other!
GENERATED_EN: danced and kissed!

FR: N'ayant plus rien à craindre, ils pénétrèrent dans la maison de la sorcière.
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX PLUS PEUR ENTRER MAISON SORCIERE
GENERATED_LSF: PLUS AYANT CRAINDRE MAISON SORCIERE PENETRER
EN: And as they had nothing more to fear they went over all the old witch's house,
GENERATED_EN: With nothing more to fear, they entered the witch's house.

FR: Dans tous les coins, il y avait des caisses pleines de perles et de diamants.
GLOSS_LSF: MAISON CHACUN COIN MALLE DEDANS PERLES DIAMANT
GENERATED_LSF: TOUS COINS CAISSES PLEINES PERLES DIAMANTS AVOIR
EN: and in every corner there stood chests of pearls and precious stones.
GENERATED_EN: In every corner, there were boxes full of pearls and diamonds.

FR: C'est encore mieux que mes petits cailloux! dit Hansel en remplissant ses poches.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL DIRE MIEUX QUE MES CAILLOUX ! LUI REMPLIR SES POCHES
GENERATED_LSF: ENCORE MIEUX PETITS CAILLOUX HANSEL POCHES DIRE REMPLISSANT
EN: This is something better than flint stones, said Hansel, as he filled his pockets,  carry something home with her, filled her apron full!
GENERATED_EN: This is even better than my little stones!" said Hansel, filling his pockets.

FR: Et Grethel pensa : Moi aussi, je veux en rapporter à la maison!
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL PENSER MOI AUSSI VOULOIR RAPPORTER MAISON
GENERATED_LSF: GRETHEL PENSA MOI AUSSI MAISON VOULOIR RAPPORTER
EN: and Grethel, thinking she also would like to
GENERATED_EN: And Grethel thought, "I want to take some home too!

FR: Maintenant, il nous faut partir, dit Hansel, si nous voulons fuir cette forêt ensorcelée.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL DIRE MAINTENANT FAUT PARTIR SI VOULOIR FUIR MAISON ENCORCELER
GENERATED_LSF: MAINTENANT FALLOIR PARTIR HANSEL DIRE FORET VOULOIR FUIR ENSORCELEE
EN: Now, away we go, said Hansel, if we only can get out of the witch's wood.
GENERATED_EN: Now we must leave," said Hansel, "if we are to escape this bewitched forest.

FR: Au bout de quelques heures, ils arrivèrent sur les bords d'une grande rivière.
GLOSS_LSF: QUELQUES HEURES GRANDE RIVIERE ARRIVER BORD
GENERATED_LSF: BOUT HEURES BORDS GRANDE RIVIERE ARRIVER
EN: When they had journeyed a few hours they came to a great piece of water.
GENERATED_EN: After a few hours, they arrived at the banks of a large river.

FR: Nous ne pourrons pas la traverser, dit Hansel, je ne vois ni passerelle ni pont.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL DIRE IMPOSSIBLE TRAVERSER PAS PASSERELLE PAS PONT
GENERATED_LSF: NE PAS POUVOIR TRAVERSER HANSEL DIRE NE PASSERELLE VOIR PONT
EN: We can never get across this, said Hansel, I see no stepping-stones and no bridge.
GENERATED_EN: We won't be able to cross it," said Hansel, "I don't see a bridge or a footbridge.

FR: On n'y voit aucune barque non plus, dit Grethel.
GLOSS_LSF: GRETHEL DIRE PAS BARQUE NON PLUS
GENERATED_LSF: BARQUE NON PLUS VOIR GRETHEL DIRE
EN: And there is no boat either, said Grethel;
GENERATED_EN: There are no boats there either," said Grethel.

FR: Mais voici un canard blanc.
GLOSS_LSF: MAIS LA CANARD BLANC
EN: but here comes a white duck;
GENERATED_EN: But here is a white duck.

FR: Si Je lui demande, il nous aidera à traverser.
GLOSS_LSF: SI MOI DEMANDER LUI AIDER NOUS TRAVERSER
EN: if I ask her she will help us over.
GENERATED_EN: If I ask him, he will help us to cross.

FR: Elle cria:
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE CRIER
EN: So she cried,
GENERATED_EN: She shouted:

FR: Petit canard, petit canard,
GLOSS_LSF: CANARD CANARD
EN: Duck, duck, here we stand,
GENERATED_EN: Little duck, little duck,

FR: Nous sommes Hansel et Grethel.
GLOSS_LSF: NOUS HANSEL GRETHEL
EN: Hansel and Grethel, on the land,
GENERATED_EN: We are Hansel and Grethel.

FR: Il n'y a ni barque, ni gué, ni pont,
GLOSS_LSF: PAS BARQUE PAS PONT PAS PASSERELLE
EN: Stepping-stones and bridge we lack,
GENERATED_EN: There is no boat, no ford, no bridge,

FR: Fais-nous passer avant qu'il ne soit tard.
GLOSS_LSF: S'IL TE PLAIT AIDER NOUS PASSER AVANT TROP TARD
EN: Carry us over on your nice white back.
GENERATED_EN: Get us through before it's late.

FR: Le petit canard s'approcha
GLOSS_LSF: CANARD S'APPROCHER
EN: And the duck came accordingly,
GENERATED_EN: The little duckling approached

FR: et Hansel se mit à califourchon sur son dos.
GLOSS_LSF: HANSEL MONTER SUR SON DOS
EN: and Hansel got upon her
GENERATED_EN: and Hansel straddled his back.

FR: Il demanda à sa soeur de prendre place à côté de lui.
GLOSS_LSF: LUI DEMANDER SA SOEUR MONTER A COTE
EN: and told his sister to come too.
GENERATED_EN: He asked his sister to sit next to him.

FR: Non, répondit-elle, ce serait trop lourd pour le canard.
GLOSS_LSF: ELLE REPONDRE NON TROP LOURD POUR CANARD
EN: No, answered Grethel, that would be too hard upon the duck;
GENERATED_EN: No," she replied, "that would be too heavy for the duck.

FR: Nous traverserons l'un après l'autre.
GLOSS_LSF: TRAVERSER CHACUN SON TOUR
EN: we can go separately, one after the other.
GENERATED_EN: We will cross one after the other.

FR: La bonne petite bête les mena ainsi à bon port.
GLOSS_LSF: CANARD GENTIL AMENER L'UN PUIS L'AUTRE
GENERATED_LSF: BONNE PETITE BETE MENA AINSI BON PORT
EN: And that was how it was managed,
GENERATED_EN: The good little beast thus led them to their destination.

FR: Quand ils eurent donc passé l'eau sans dommage,
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX PASSER SANS PROBLEME
EN: and after that they went on happily,
GENERATED_EN: When they had passed the water without damage,

FR: ils s'aperçurent au bout de quelque temps que la forêt leur devenait de plus en plus familière.
GLOSS_LSF: APERCEVOIR FORET CONNAITRE DEJA VU ICI
GENERATED_LSF: BOUT TEMPS FORET PLUS PLUS FAMILIERE APERCEVOIR DEVENIR
EN: until they came to the wood, and the way grew more and more familiar,
GENERATED_EN: After a while, they realized that the forest was becoming more and more familiar to them.

FR: Finalement, ils virent au loin la maison de leur père.
GLOSS_LSF: MOMENT VOIR LOIN MAISON LEUR PERE
EN: till at last they saw in the distance their father's house.
GENERATED_EN: Finally, they saw their father's house in the distance.

FR: Ils se mirent à courir, se ruèrent dans la chambre de leurs parents
GLOSS_LSF: DEUX COURIR COURIR CHAMBRE LEUR PARENTS ARRIVER
EN: Then they ran till they came up to it, rushed in at the door,
GENERATED_EN: They started to run, rushed to their parents' room

FR: et sautèrent au cou de leur père.
GLOSS_LSF: LEUR PERE SAUTER SON COU CALIN
EN: and fell on their father's neck.
